comments:
* DTP 1.0 RC2 12/19 build *
* PostgreSQL 8.1 *

Create a cp for PostgreSQL 8.x, right context and "Save Offline" the following error occurs:

eclipse.buildId=M20060921-0945
java.version=1.4.2_06
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Command-line arguments:  -os win32 -ws win32 -arch x86 -clean

Error
Tue Dec 19 15:45:53 EST 2006
An internal error occurred during: "Save Offline".

java.lang.AbstractMethodError: org.postgresql.jdbc2.Jdbc2DatabaseMetaData.getAttributes(Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;Ljava/lang/String;)Ljava/sql/ResultSet;
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.loader.JDBCUDTAttributeLoader.createResultSet(JDBCUDTAttributeLoader.java:175)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.loader.JDBCUDTAttributeLoader.loadAttributeDefinitions(JDBCUDTAttributeLoader.java:153)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.rte.jdbc.JDBCStructuredUDT.loadAttributes(JDBCStructuredUDT.java:82)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.rte.jdbc.JDBCStructuredUDT.getAttributes(JDBCStructuredUDT.java:64)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.core.rte.jdbc.JDBCStructuredUDT.eIsSet(JDBCStructuredUDT.java:126)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EContentsEList$FeatureIteratorImpl.hasNext(EContentsEList.java:414)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil$ProperContentIterator.hasNext(EcoreUtil.java:1165)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.util.EcoreUtil$ContentTreeIterator.hasNext(EcoreUtil.java:1341)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl.attached(ResourceImpl.java:773)
	at org.eclipse.emf.ecore.resource.impl.ResourceImpl$ContentsEList.inverseAdd(ResourceImpl.java:348)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.notify.impl.NotifyingListImpl.addUnique(NotifyingListImpl.java:310)
	at org.eclipse.emf.common.util.BasicEList.add(BasicEList.java:600)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.ResourceUtil.resolveDanglingReferencesInternal(ResourceUtil.java:47)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.ResourceUtil.resolveDanglingReferencesInternal(ResourceUtil.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.ResourceUtil.resolveDanglingReferencesInternal(ResourceUtil.java:49)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.ResourceUtil.resolveDanglingReferences(ResourceUtil.java:33)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.internal.core.connection.ConnectionInfoImpl.cacheDatabase(ConnectionInfoImpl.java:337)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.sqm.server.internal.ui.explorer.actions.popup.SaveOfflineAction$UpdateJob.run(SaveOfflineAction.java:108)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

If we can not support generic offline saves apart from Derby, the either the "Save Offline" action should be available only for Derby, or (better) we should create an extension point for vendor specialization in this area.

Changed summary as I don't think this is releated to work offline (although this exposes the problem).

Looks like the problem is caused by the fact that the generic catalog loader does not accommodate unimplemented methods on DatabaseMetaData.
fixed.  catch runtime exceptions and convert them to sql exceptions when invoking unimplemented database meta-data methods.
